l10n_infotext_listsubs1.en: This is where you manage subscriber accounts. A subscriber in this context is typically one of your customers that has subscribed to your TCS service.

l10n_infotext_listsubs2.en: You can modify and delete subscribers here. If you want to add new subscriber, you can do this under:

l10n_infotext_listsubs3.en: A subscriber can be in one of three states:

l10n_expl_subscribed.en: Users can get certificates from the portal

l10n_expl_unsubscribed.en: Not yet ready to issue certificates to the users.

l10n_expl_suspended.en: Users may not issue new certificates.

l10n_confirm_deleteownsubs.en: You are about to delete your OWN INSTITUTION

l10n_confirm_delete_subscriber.en: You are about to delete subscriber

l10n_infotext_dn.en: The name that goes into the certificate must be a stable value. If this needs to change, the subscriber must be removed and created anew with the new name.

l10n_infotext_contactinfo.en: Official contact. This is where the policy-makers reside. Whenever a contract needs signing etc.

l10n_infotext_resppers.en: Technical contact - not enduser support. Whenever there are issues with attributes etc.

l10n_infotext_helpdesk.en: End-user support. Where you want the portal to send general inquiries (support questions).

l10n_infotext_comments.en: Comments regarding the subscriber that cannot fit into the pre-defined fields. Note that this field will never be exposed to the subscriber, so you cannot use this to send in-portal messages to the Subscriber's administrators.

l10n_infotext_addnew1.en: This is where you add new subscribers. Every element is given a thorough explanation. If in doubt, consult other NREN-administrators near you or operational support.

l10n_infotext_attnm1.en: The attribute-name of the subscriber, is the name the way it is exported from the IdP.

l10n_infotext_attnm2.en: For your NREN this is the value of the following attribute (configured here):

l10n_infotext_attnm3.en: Enter the value that the IdP will assign to this attribute for the subscriber you add.

l10n_infotext_dnoname1.en: The Organization-Name is the name that will appear in the certificate for the end entities (the users). I.e. it is the string appearing in the /O=... section of the certificate. This name is subject to certain restrictions pertaining length, encoding etc.

l10n_infotext_gridmode.en: Currently, Confusa is placed in "Grid-mode". This means that the name for the subscriber is limited to ASCII and a maximum of 62 characters.

l10n_infotext_contactinfo2.en: This information is used by both the NREN-staff to contact the subscribers in case of an emergency, but also by confusa itself when revoking certificates, adding robot-certificates etc.

l10n_infotext_contactinfo3.en: It is important that the contact-information is as up-to-date as possible.

l10n_expl_resppers.en: Technical contact - not end user support

l10n_infotext_helpdeskcont.en: Whenever an end-user needs help, the user should be directed to the helpdesk run by the subscriber. Operational support or NREN-support should not be required to handle large number of issues that can (and should) be resolved by local IT-support staff.

l10n_infotext_arbcomm1.en: In case a general comment concerning the subscriber is needed, you can add this here. This comment will only be available through this page, so what you write here, will neither be exposed to subscribers, nor to end entities.

l10n_infotext_subscrstate.en: The state describes how a subscriber is treated. At the moment you have 3 different states in Confusa.

l10n_infotext_subscribed.en: When a subscriber is in this state, the contract between the NREN and subscriber is signed, the subscriber has agreed to follow the requirements placed upon it in the CP/CPS document etc. This state indicates that the subscriber is ready to use Confusa.

l10n_infotext_unsubscribed.en: The subscriber has been added to the register of Subscriber, but has not yet signed the contractual agreements and can therefore not be elevated to state "Subscribed".

l10n_infotext_suspended.en: Due to violations of the terms in the contracts, all activity for the subscriber has been ceased. No certificates will be removed, but new ones will not be issued to the users. Once the issues have been resolved, the state can be changed back to "Subscribed".

l10n_infotext_revise.en: Before you continue, you should read through the values set to make sure they are correct. If you are satisifed, you can continue to add the subscriber.

l10n_suc_editsubs1.en: Subscriber successfully saved to persistent storage.

l10n_fail_editsubs1.en: Could not update Subscriber, even with changed information.

l10n_fail_edit_subscr_state.en: Could not update state of subscriber. Is the database-layer broken?

l10n_infotext_attruid.en:
The attribute that is used for transporting the unique identifier for that subscriber. Change this value only if the subscriber requires a different attribute key for the unique identifier than the NREN.

Example: The NREN setting is ePPN but the subscriber wishes to identify its users by eduPersonTargetedID.

l10n_intotext_attruid_short.en: The attribute that is used for identifying users at that subscriber. This information will both be part of the certificate-DN as well as serve for identifying administrators.

l10n_error_illegalattributemap.en: Your subscriber could not be found. Please check that an organization attribute is exported by your IdP and correctly mapped in the portal. Before adding/editing subscribers you must configure the
